thread.title: Tom Brady Now Has More Super Bowl Rings Than Any Other Quarterback | The Huffington Post
thread.title_full: Tom Brady Now Has More Super Bowl Rings Than Any Other Quarterback | The Huffington Post

author: Maxwell Strachan
title: Tom Brady Now Has More Super Bowl Rings Than Any Other Quarterback | The Huffington Post
text:
Tom Brady Now Has More Super Bowl Rings Than Any Other Quarterback After Sunday's performance, Brady is now in a class of his own. 02/05/2017 10:44 pm ET Maxwell Strachan Senior Editor, The Huffington Post Tim Bradbury via Getty Images No quarterback has ever won as many Super Bowl rings as Tom Brady. 
With his team’s stunning come-from-behind victory on Sunday in Super Bowl LI on Sunday, New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady now has more Super Bowl rings than any other quarterback in NFL history, with five. 
Among all current and former players, only Charles Haley, a former defensive end for the San Francisco 49ers and Dallas Cowboys, now holds as many rings as Brady. 
On Sunday, the quarterback broke numerous records against the Atlanta Falcons in Houston, Texas, including most passing yards, with 466, most pass completions, with 43, on the way to the team’s 34-28 overtime victory. 
It’s been 15 years since Brady’s Super Bowl victory in 2002, when the then-24-year-old earned Super Bowl MVP after throwing for 145 yards against Kurt Warner and the St. Louis Rams. 
Brady has long held the record for both most regular season and postseason wins of any quarterback. Now, he has the Super Bowl record to match. Also on HuffPost Super Bowl Trolls Trump 7 Super Bowl Trolls Trump
